title: Iterated logarithm
summary: In computer science, the iterated logarithm of n {\displaystyle n} , written log* n {\displaystyle n} (usually read "log star"), is the number of times the logarithm function must be  iteratively applied before the result is less than or equal to 1 {\displaystyle 1} .[1] The simplest formal definition is the result of this recurrence relation:
